titles.title: A bill to reinstate and extend the deadline for commencement of construction of a hydroelectric project involving the American Falls Reservoir.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Wyden without amendment. With written report No. 113-24. Additional views filed.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 55.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Power.
Mr. Whitfield moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 276.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Mr. Whitfield objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/26/2014--Public Law. Directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC), upon the request of the licensee for the project numbered 12423 (American Falls Reservoir, Idaho), to reinstate the license and extend for three years after enactment of this Act the time period during which the licensee is required to commence the construction of project works.
